text: Labé is a region in north-central Guinea. It is bordered by the countries of Senegal and Mali and the Guinean regions of Faranah, Kindia, Mamou, and Boké. The regional capital is the city of Labé. As of the 2014 census, 995,717 people lived there. It has an area of . == Prefectures == * Koubia Prefecture * Labé Prefecture * Lélouma Prefecture * Mali Prefecture * Tougué Prefecture Category:Regions of Guinea
title: Labé Region
